result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy L Wollitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent
2.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription

records.addlTxt:
11:35 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge.  DA concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

court costs
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Court adjourned at 11:42 a.m.
Status hearing at 05-19-2015 11:00 am

2:28 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty privat - has reviewed Discovery and needs to get an offer.  Court will set for status hearing on May 19, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Corut adjourned at 2:28 p.m.
Status hearing on March 31, 2015 at 2:30 pm.
Status hearing on March 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

2:35 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Atty Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - needs time to review and pretrial it.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 10, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:36 p.m.

for Discovery (Defendant's)

Status hearing on February 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

11:24 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat, defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for status hearing on February 10, 2015 at 2:00 P.M.

Court adjourned at 11:27 a.m.
Status hearing on January 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
By Atty Barb Privat
Status hearing on December 22, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

1:18 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant, will be obtaining an attorney, just qualified for a public defender.  Court will set for status hearing in 2 weeks.

Court adjourned at 1:19 p.m.
Status hearing on December 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

1:57 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant, will be getting an attorney, has an appointment tomorrow.  Court goes over previous hearings.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by defendant.  Court adjourns one more time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.  Court will set for status hearing in 2 weeks - mandatory appearance of defendant.

Court adjourned at 2:00 p.m.
Status hearing on November 25, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant called in regards to the warrant letter he received.  Defendant to appear in court on November 25, 2014 at 1:00 p.m.  Defendant's address on file is correct.  Informed the defendant that if a NOR is filed by his attorney, the hearing will be removed from the court calendar and scheduled with the attorney.

Defendant called in regards to the warrant letter he received.  Got his number, criminal clerk will call him back.

Warrant letter sent to the defendant - respond on or before November 10, 2014 or warrant will be issued.

1:24 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders a warrant and stayed for two weeks.

Court adjourned at 1:24 p.m.
Status hearing on October 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

1:22 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.   Statement by defendant will be getting an attorney and will be retaining one privately and has been saving money to do so.  Court will set for status in 3 weeks.

Court adjourned at 1:22 p.m.
Status hearing on October 7, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

1:58 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant, requests more time to obtain an attorney.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.  Defendant requests 3 weeks.  Court will set for status of counsel in 3 weeks.

Court adjourned at 1:59 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on September 16, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

10:31 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will be getting an attorney.  Further statement by defendant, requests 3 weeks to obtain an attorney.  Court sets for status hearing in 3 weeks.

Court adjourned at 10:32 a.m.
Status hearing on August 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.

9:32 a.m.  Defendant present in court, in custody and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson as Special Prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Bond has been set.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing regarding counsel  in approx 2 weeks.

Court adjourned at 9:35 a.m.
Bail Bond Deposit Acknowledgement w/attachment

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.  Defendant is not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.  Defendant is not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

1:02 P.M.  Defendant present in court, in custody via video from the Green Lake County Jail.  Steven Anderson as Special Prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin - via telphone.  Statement by special prosecutor - referral for charges for bail jumping, and makes bond recommendation.  Court orders bond set at $400.00 cash and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.  Defendant is not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Initial Appearance - July 28, 2014 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:05 p.m.
